name: Earth Lusca
descr:
[Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) is a suspected China-based cyber espionage group that has been active since at least April 2019. [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) has targeted organizations in Australia, China, Hong Kong, Mongolia, Nepal, the Philippines, Taiwan, Thailand, Vietnam, the United Arab Emirates, Nigeria, Germany, France, and the United States. Targets included government institutions, news media outlets, gambling companies, educational institutions, COVID-19 research organizations, telecommunications companies, religious movements banned in China, and cryptocurrency trading platforms; security researchers assess some [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) operations may be financially motivated.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

[Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) has used malware commonly used by other Chinese threat groups, including [APT41](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0096) and the [Winnti Group](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0044) cluster, however security researchers assess [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006)'s techniques and infrastructure are separate.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

subtechniques.name: Bypass User Account Control
subtechniques.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) has used the Fodhelper UAC bypass technique to gain elevated privileges.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

subtechniques.name: SSH Authorized Keys
subtechniques.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) has dropped an SSH-authorized key in the `/root/.ssh` folder in order to access a compromised server with SSH.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

subtechniques.name: Domains
subtechniques.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) has registered domains, intended to look like legitimate target domains, that have been used in watering hole attacks.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

subtechniques.name: Server
subtechniques.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) has acquired multiple servers for some of their operations, using each server for a different role.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

subtechniques.name: Web Services
subtechniques.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) has established GitHub accounts to host their malware.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

subtechniques.name: Vulnerability Scanning
subtechniques.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) has scanned for vulnerabilities in the public-facing servers of their targets.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

subtechniques.name: Archive via Utility
subtechniques.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) has used WinRAR to compress stolen files into an archive prior to exfiltration.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

subtechniques.name: Print Processors
subtechniques.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) has added the Registry key `HKLM\SYSTEM\ControlSet001\Control\Print\Environments\Windows x64\Print Processors\UDPrint” /v Driver /d “spool.dll /f` to load malware as a Print Processor.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

subtechniques.name: PowerShell
subtechniques.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) has used PowerShell to execute commands.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

subtechniques.name: Visual Basic
subtechniques.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) used VBA scripts.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

subtechniques.name: Python
subtechniques.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) used Python scripts for port scanning or building reverse shells.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

subtechniques.name: JavaScript
subtechniques.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) has manipulated legitimate websites to inject malicious JavaScript code as part of their watering hole operations.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

subtechniques.name: Server
subtechniques.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) has used compromised web servers as part of their operational infrastructure.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

subtechniques.name: Web Services
subtechniques.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) has compromised Google Drive repositories.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

subtechniques.name: Windows Service
subtechniques.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) created a service using the command sc create “SysUpdate” binpath= “cmd /c start “[file path]””&&sc config “SysUpdate” start= auto&&net start SysUpdate for persistence.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

technique_table_data.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
technique_table_data.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) has used [certutil](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0160) to decode a string into a cabinet file.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

technique_table_data.name: Domain Trust Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) has used [Nltest](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0359) to obtain information about domain controllers.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

technique_table_data.name: Drive-by Compromise
technique_table_data.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) has performed watering hole attacks.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

subtechniques.name: Exfiltration to Cloud Storage
subtechniques.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) has used the megacmd tool to upload stolen files from a victim network to MEGA.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

technique_table_data.name: Exploit Public-Facing Application
technique_table_data.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) has compromised victims by directly exploiting vulnerabilities of public-facing servers, including those associated with Microsoft Exchange and Oracle GlassFish.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

technique_table_data.name: Exploitation of Remote Services
technique_table_data.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) has used [Mimikatz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0002) to exploit a domain controller via the ZeroLogon exploit (CVE-2020-1472).(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

subtechniques.name: DLL
subtechniques.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) has placed a malicious payload in `%WINDIR%\SYSTEM32\oci.dll` so it would be sideloaded by the MSDTC service.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

subtechniques.name: Match Legitimate Resource Name or Location
subtechniques.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) used the command `move [file path] c:\windows\system32\spool\prtprocs\x64\spool.dll` to move and register a malicious DLL name as a Windows print processor, which eventually was loaded by the Print Spooler service.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

technique_table_data.name: Modify Registry
technique_table_data.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) modified the registry using the command reg add “HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Environment” /v UserInitMprLogonScript /t REG_SZ /d “[file path]” for persistence.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

technique_table_data.name: Obfuscated Files or Information

subtechniques.name: Steganography
subtechniques.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) has used steganography to hide shellcode in a BMP image file.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

technique_table_data.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) used Base64 to encode strings.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

subtechniques.name: Malware
subtechniques.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) has acquired and used a variety of malware, including [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154).(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

subtechniques.name: Tool
subtechniques.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) has acquired and used a variety of open source tools.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

subtechniques.name: LSASS Memory
subtechniques.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) has used ProcDump to obtain the hashes of credentials by dumping the memory of the LSASS process.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

subtechniques.name: DCSync
subtechniques.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) has used a DCSync command with [Mimikatz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0002) to retrieve credentials from an exploited controller.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

subtechniques.name: Spearphishing Link
subtechniques.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) has sent spearphishing emails to potential targets that contained a malicious link.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

technique_table_data.name: Process Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) has used [Tasklist](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0057) to obtain information from a compromised host.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

technique_table_data.name: Proxy
technique_table_data.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) adopted Cloudflare as a proxy for compromised servers.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

technique_table_data.name: Remote System Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) used the command powershell “Get-EventLog -LogName security -Newest 500 | where {$_.EventID -eq 4624} | format-list - property * | findstr “Address”” to find the network information of successfully logged-in accounts to discovery addresses of other machines. [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) has also used multiple scanning tools to discover other machines within the same compromised network.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

technique_table_data.name: Scheduled Task/Job
technique_table_data.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) used the command schtasks /Create /SC ONLOgon /TN WindowsUpdateCheck /TR “[file path]” /ru system for persistence.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

subtechniques.name: Upload Malware
subtechniques.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) has staged malware and malicious files on compromised web servers, GitHub, and Google Drive.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

subtechniques.name: Mshta
subtechniques.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) has used `mshta.exe` to load an HTA script within a malicious .LNK file.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

technique_table_data.name: System Network Configuration Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) used the command ipconfig to obtain information about network configurations.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

technique_table_data.name: System Network Connections Discovery
technique_table_data.descr:
[Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) employed a PowerShell script called RDPConnectionParser to read and filter the Windows event log “Microsoft-Windows-TerminalServices-RDPClient/Operational”
(Event ID 1024) to obtain network information from RDP connections. [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) has also used [netstat](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0104) from a compromised system to obtain network connection information.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

technique_table_data.name: System Owner/User Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) collected information on user accounts via the whoami command.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

technique_table_data.name: System Service Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) has used [Tasklist](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0057) to obtain information from a compromised host.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

subtechniques.name: Malicious Link
subtechniques.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006)  has sent spearphishing emails that required the user to click on a malicious link and subsequently open a decoy document with a malicious loader.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

subtechniques.name: Malicious File
subtechniques.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) required users to click on a malicious file for the loader to activate.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

technique_table_data.name: Windows Management Instrumentation
technique_table_data.descr: [Earth Lusca](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1006) used a VBA script to execute WMI.(Citation: TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022)

techniques.name: Hijack Execution Flow
techniques.sub_name: Path Interception by PATH Environment Variable

techniques.name: Hijack Execution Flow
techniques.sub_name: Path Interception by Search Order Hijacking

alias_descriptions.name: CHROMIUM
alias_descriptions.descr: (Citation: Microsoft Threat Actor Naming July 2023) (Citation: Recorded Future RedHotel August 2023)

TrendMicro EarthLusca 2022.description: Chen, J., et al. (2022). Delving Deep: An Analysis of Earth Lusca’s Operations. Retrieved July 1, 2022.

Recorded Future TAG-22 July 2021.description: INSIKT GROUP. (2021, July 8). Chinese State-Sponsored Activity Group TAG-22 Targets Nepal, the Philippines, and Taiwan Using Winnti and Other Tooling. Retrieved September 16, 2024.

Recorded Future RedHotel August 2023.description: Insikt Group. (2023, August 8). RedHotel: A Prolific, Chinese State-Sponsored Group Operating at a Global Scale. Retrieved March 11, 2024.
